intro: Oxera macrocalyx subsp. sororia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
